snippet: There has been a worrisome increase in the hiring of adjunct instructors, who are generally poorly paid and have less time for research.
abstract: Editorial laments universities' increasing employment of adjunct professors, who are paid per course, paid poorly and are given few or little benefits; says reliance on such professors not only affects employees themselves, but may also degrade education quality; also questions rising numbers of administrators, who are paid more than adjuncts.
lead_paragraph: There has been a worrisome increase in the hiring of adjunct instructors, who are generally poorly paid and have less time for research.
